Hi Ken,
	Thanks for the response.
> We don't give accounts to anyone except immediate members of the group.
That makes sense, and is what I expected to be the case, but there where
so many reference to the papers concerned from outside, that it gave me
the impression I may be wrong. Hence the original query.

> My understanding was that you tried to download some papers and it
> wouldn't let you do that.
Yes, that's where my problem started. It was about a week ago, and late
one evening. So do not put too much reliance on my memory. I had
followed a link, from your recent YouTube video in Melbourne, to:

   http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/uncategorised/software#noveltysearch

I selected a reference to a paper of interest, but can't remember which
one exactly, but the link took me to a page with the  abstract and a
further link to download the paper, which required me to log in to
my account, via the page described in my earlier email.

This morning, I am unable to recall exactly which publication was
involved, despite trying the ones I thought would be most likely.
So either my memory is letting me down, most likely, or the site
has changed (I suspect Occam would dictate the former :-)

I have three days allocated to this, next week. So if I can replicate
the problem, I'll email directly with full details.

Rob Marsden
